feed.title: Korthauer Lab
feed.subtitle: We work on advancing statistical methodology and computational tools for the analysis of high-dimensional genomics data. With these tools, we aim to uncover new molecular signals in cancer, child health, and development.

entry.title: Congratulations to our two Fall 2023 MS graduates!

link.title: Congratulations to our two Fall 2023 MS graduates!

entry.content: Congratulations to Korthauer lab members Giuliano Netto Flores Cruz (MS Bioinformatics, pictured below) and Giuesppe Tinti Tomio (MS Statistics)!!
entry.summary: Congratulations to Korthauer lab members Giuliano Netto Flores Cruz (MS Bioinformatics, pictured below) and Giuesppe Tinti Tomio (MS Statistics)!!

entry.title: New preprint
entry.content: Our new preprint, “vmrseq: Probabilistic Modeling of Single-cell Methylation Heterogeneity” is posted!
entry.summary: Our new preprint, “vmrseq: Probabilistic Modeling of Single-cell Methylation Heterogeneity” is posted!

entry.title: Erick presenting at Epigenomics of Common Diseases 2023

link.title: Erick presenting at Epigenomics of Common Diseases 2023

entry.content: Erick is presenting his work on “Modeling the genome and prenatal exposome contribution to newborn DNA methylome variability with the RAMEN package” at the 2023 Conference on Epigenomics of Common Diseases at the Wellcome Genome Campus in the UK!
entry.summary: Erick is presenting his work on “Modeling the genome and prenatal exposome contribution to newborn DNA methylome variability with the RAMEN package” at the 2023 Conference on Epigenomics of Common Diseases at the Wellcome Genome Campus in the UK!

entry.title: Keegan presenting at Women in Statistics and Data Science 2023

link.title: Keegan presenting at Women in Statistics and Data Science 2023

entry.content: Keegan is presenting work led by Ning Shen on “Probabilistic modelling of single-cell methylation sequencing data reveals regions that are informative of cell type and cell state” at the 2023 Women in Statistics and Data Science conference in Bellvue, WA.
entry.summary: Keegan is presenting work led by Ning Shen on “Probabilistic modelling of single-cell methylation sequencing data reveals regions that are informative of cell type and cell state” at the 2023 Women in Statistics and Data Science conference in Bellvue, WA.

entry.title: Keegan and Erick to speak at VanBUG Seminar

link.title: Keegan and Erick to speak at VanBUG Seminar

entry.content: Keegan and Erick are speaking at the upcoming VanBUG seminar on September 21, 2023.
entry.summary: Keegan and Erick are speaking at the upcoming VanBUG seminar on September 21, 2023.

entry.title: Welcome to our News Page!
entry.content: We’ll be sharing the latest lab news here. Check back regularly to see what we are up to!
entry.summary: We’ll be sharing the latest lab news here. Check back regularly to see what we are up to!

entry.title: Congratulations to Erick for being awarded a UBC 4YF!

link.title: Congratulations to Erick for being awarded a UBC 4YF!

entry.content: Congratulations to Erick for being awarded a UBC Four Year Doctoral Fellowship from the Bioinformatics program!
entry.summary: Congratulations to Erick for being awarded a UBC Four Year Doctoral Fellowship from the Bioinformatics program!
